meanings.definition: Relating to the sounds of a language.
meanings.sent1: The phonological differences between the two languages were fascinating.
meanings.sent2: Linguists study phonological patterns in different dialects.
meanings.sent3: The phonological puzzle was finally solved by the clever researcher.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a phonological melody that enchanted everyone.
meanings.sent5: The phonological aspect of the poem made it a joy to listen to.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the study of speech sounds.
meanings.sent1: The phonological research helped improve speech therapy techniques.
meanings.sent2: The phonological analysis revealed interesting patterns in the speech data.
meanings.sent3: The phonological experiment unexpectedly led to a breakthrough in communication studies.
meanings.sent4: His phonological expertise made him a sought-after consultant in the field.
meanings.sent5: The phonological nuances in her speech were subtle but significant.

meanings.sent1: Her phonological struggles made it hard for others to understand her.
meanings.sent2: The phonological errors in his speech were gradually corrected with practice.
meanings.sent3: The phonological challenge of pronouncing 'onomatopoeia' made the class burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: His phonological precision in articulating difficult words impressed the audience.
meanings.sent5: The phonological clarity of her pronunciation made her a great public speaker.
